subject: Management
title: The Manager as Mediator
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Manager as Mediator.

hook.text: Two direct reports couldn't work together. Their manager picked a side. The whole team fractured.

buildup.text: When you manage both parties, taking sides destroys trust with the one you didn't pick.

discovery.text: A manager-mediator stays neutral, facilitates dialogue, and helps both sides find resolution.

twist.text: Neutrality doesn't mean passivity. You still set boundaries and enforce standards.

climax.text: Your job isn't to judge who's right. It's to get both people back to productive collaboration.

punchline.text: Don't pick a side. Pick a solution.

quiz.question: What is the manager's role when mediating between two team members?
options: Stay neutral and facilitate dialogue toward resolution
Pick the side that seems most reasonable
Let them work it out entirely on their own
